text: The drought minister’s office is clarifying government policy after David Littleproud told the ABC’s Q&A program that no farmers will be kicked off the Farm Household Allowance. Mr Littleproud's comments appear to be at odds with comments made by Prime Minister Scott Morrison, who has previously said that farmers will receive a one-off top-up payment once the Farm Household Allowance comes to an end. On Q&A, Mr Littleproud insisted that the payments will be ongoing for drought-stricken farmers. “Those that come off [the Farm Household Allowance] after four years will continue to stay on under the supplementary payments until the drought is over,” he said on Monday night. “It's not correct to say people are being kicked off the Farm Household Allowance. “No one will be." Environment Minister Sussan Ley has also previously said that future support will depend on a farmer’s circumstances. Image: News Corp Australia
